content.raw:
I think we don't explicitly define the user-configuration or default value of the canonical link here, though we discuss it a bit after the short examples.

Perhaps we should add: The name of the canonical link can be specified in the `//model/@canonical_link` attribute. If it is not specified, then the first `//link` element in the model is chosen as the canonical link.
content.html:
I think we don't explicitly define the user-configuration or default value of the canonical link here, though we discuss it a bit after the short examples.

Perhaps we should add: The name of the canonical link can be specified in the //model/@canonical_link attribute. If it is not specified, then the first //link element in the model is chosen as the canonical link.

content.raw:
That’s right, it’s there to maintain the structure.  If I combine the two statements, maybe it will sound less awkward but still fulfill the template:

“Defining these semantics, which were missing from SDFormat 1.5, minimizes redundancy in poses and offsets and make relationships between physical elements easier to interpret.”

Or something like that.

‌

content.raw:
nit Is there a way that we could somehow have Markdown /  HTML handle this numbering?

Main concern is that this affects the anchors, where they’d get invalidated if a new section gets added in before it. \(Perhaps not a huge deal…\)
content.html:
nit Is there a way that we could somehow have Markdown / HTML handle this numbering?

Main concern is that this affects the anchors, where they’d get invalidated if a new section gets added in before it. (Perhaps not a huge deal…)

content.raw:
I looked around and I don’t think Markdown can do it out-of-the-box.  It is bad that numbers will have to be manually changed though.

At least right now there’s only one anchor that references a numbered section \(line 77\)

content.raw:
Currently, the indentation \+ surround `~~~` tokens messes with the formatting:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/znjR7a/images/1202142219-image.png)
Can you remove the indentation?
content.html:
Currently, the indentation + surround ~~~ tokens messes with the formatting:

Can you remove the indentation?

content.raw:
there are two ways to make code blocks: indenting and wrapping in `~~~`

if you want to have multiple distinct code blocks, you need to wrap them in `~~~`. If you indent them, they will all merge into a single code block.

I think indenting the `~~~` characters causes them to be included in the code block, so it should be one or the other, not both
content.html:
there are two ways to make code blocks: indenting and wrapping in ~~~

if you want to have multiple distinct code blocks, you need to wrap them in ~~~. If you indent them, they will all merge into a single code block.

I think indenting the ~~~ characters causes them to be included in the code block, so it should be one or the other, not both
